arn.description: The ARN of the domain identity.

domain.description: The domain name to assign to SES

verificationToken.description:
A code which when added to the domain as a TXT record
will signal to SES that the owner of the domain has authorised SES to act on
their behalf. The domain identity will be in state "verification pending"
until this is done. See the With Route53 Record example
for how this might be achieved when the domain is hosted in Route 53 and
managed by this provider.  Find out more about verifying domains in Amazon
SES in the [AWS SES
docs](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ses/latest/DeveloperGuide/verify-domains.html).

domain.description: The domain name to assign to SES

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DomainIdentity resources.
